Tavatron:

Tavatron growled softly, why did Dinobot refuse to meet her gaze? What was 
he hiding? Tavatron sighed, no matter. When he was ready he would tell her. 
She took a few steps, amazed at how thorough Dinobot's repair system had 
been. She'd never experienced anything like it. It would have taken at least 
a mega-cycle in the 'R chamber in order to repair her, though she most 
likely wouldn't have survived without Dinobot's help.

Dinobot: " Further more, the next time that you pull a stunt like that again 
I will personally skin you alive!"

Tavatron turned to Dinobot, she was about to make some smart comment she 
would soon regret, but then she stared into his optics again. She didn't 
know what she was searching for, but this time she'd found something... 
concern. He was worried about her. Tavatron smiled:

"Is that a promise?" Tavatron placed a gentle hand on Dinobot's shoulder:

"Don't worry, I promise to never do anything like that again..." Tavatron 
bent over and picked up her staff. She turned and headed toward the ark. 
Tavatron looked over her shoulder and gave Dinobot a sly smile:

"...until the next time anyway."


>Dinobot looked back at the body of the defeated Predacon and sighed, at
>least his spark wasn't in his throat any longer.
>The immediate danger had passed, but there was still a battle to win!
>He then turned his gaze to his rifle as it lay upon the ground...*
>
>" However, you are welcome."
>
